content:
Yes, the philosophy department at the University of Rochester has several notable alumni who have gone on to make significant contributions in various fields. Some of the most famous alumni include:

1. Thomas Nagel: One of the most famous philosophers of our time, Nagel received his PhD in philosophy from the University of Rochester in 1963. He is best known for his work on the subjective nature of consciousness and the limits of scientific explanation.

2. Patricia Churchland: Churchland received her PhD in philosophy from the University of Rochester in 1979. She is a leading figure in the field of neurophilosophy, which seeks to understand the relationship between the brain and the mind.

3. T.M. Scanlon: Scanlon received his PhD in philosophy from the University of Rochester in 1967. He is best known for his work on moral theory and the nature of moral reasons.

4. Amartya Sen: Sen received his PhD in economics from the University of Rochester in 1959. While not a philosopher per se, he is a prominent public intellectual who has made significant contributions to social choice theory and welfare economics.

These are just a few examples of the University of Rochester philosophy department alumni who have gone on to achieve great things in various fields.
